poem:
**The Cost of the Empty**

Reality's grasp, talons seizing 
the fragile skein of wilderness.
Jones, an echo of man's hunger,
feasts on forbidden wings,
reditory's mark unheeded.
Nature weeps in silence,
our apologies fall weightless,
the weka's song extinguished.
"Forgive," he whispers,
as the world counts 
the cost of the empty.
